author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Hey there, thanks for the contribution! When I read the name of the package, I thought "this is something where you enter a specification and it creates the associated Julia struct". I had no clue it was at all related to statistical mechanics. Would there be a way to make the package name more explicit?
At the moment my comment is blocking registration (anyone has the power to do that, I'm not a maintainer of the registry). If it's really important for you to keep the name, I'll make it nonblocking ☺️
Hi! The name means "spectrum to structure". I can change it to InvStatMech.jl for Inverse statistical mechanics. Please let me work on that for a while.  :)

> Hi! The name means "spectrum to structure". I can change it to InvStatMech.jl for Inverse statistical mechanics. Please let me work on that for a while. :)

Thanks for the clarification! Why not use the full words then? `InverseStatisticalMechanics` or `Spectrum2Structure` also seem fine to me, and they are more in the spirit of the [package naming guidelines](https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines).
@JuliaRegistrator Please block merging as I will change the name of the package. Thanks!

> [noblock]
> 
> > Hi! The name means "spectrum to structure". I can change it to InvStatMech.jl for Inverse statistical mechanics. Please let me work on that for a while. :)
> 
> Thanks for the clarification! Why not use the full words then? `InverseStatisticalMechanics` or `Spectrum2Structure` also seem fine to me, and they are more in the spirit of the [package naming guidelines](https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines).

Thanks for the suggestion! I will go for `InverseStatMech` :).

> @JuliaRegistrator Please block merging as I will change the name of the package. Thanks!

As long as there is one comment without the text "[noblock]", merging is not happening :)

This pull request has been inactive for 30 days and will be automatically closed 7 days from now. If this pull request should not be closed, please either (1) fix the AutoMerge issues and re-trigger Registrator, which will automatically update the pull request, or (2) post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. [noblock]
This pull request has been inactive for more than 30 days and has automatically been closed. Feel free to register your package or version again once you fix the AutoMerge issues. [noblock]

body:
- Registering package: Spec2Struc

title: New package: Spec2Struc v1.0.0
